messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 46 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: LeTac-MPC: Learning Model Predictive Control for Tactile-reactive Grasping

Paper Abstract: Abstract Grasping is a crucial task in robotics, necessitating tactile feedback and reactive grasping adjustments for robust grasping of objects under various conditions and with differing physical properties. In this paper, we introduce LeTac-MPC, a learning-based model predictive control (MPC) for tactile-reactive grasping. Our approach enables the gripper grasp objects with different physical properties on dynamic and force-interactive tasks. We utilize a vision-based tactile sensor, GelSight [1], which is capable of perceiving high-resolution tactile feedback that contains the information of physical properties and states of the grasped object. LeTac-MPC incorporates a differentiable MPC layer designed to model the embeddings extracted by a neural network (NN) from tactile feedback. This design facilitates convergent and robust grasping control at a frequency of 25 Hz. We propose a fully automated data collection pipeline and collect a dataset only using standardized blocks with different physical properties. However, our trained controller can generalize to daily objects with different sizes, shapes, materials, and textures. Experimental results demonstrate the effectiveness and robustness of the proposed approach. We compare LeTac-MPC with two purely model-based tactile-reactive controllers (MPC and PD) and open-loop grasping. Our results show that LeTac-MPC has the best performance on dynamic and force-interactive tasks and the best generalization ability. We release our code and dataset at https://github.com/ZhengtongXu/LeTac-MPC.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 46 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 46"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "GelSight: High-resolution robot tactile sensors for estimating geometry and force",
        "ViTac: Feature sharing between vision and tactile sensing for cloth texture recognition",
        "NeuroTac: A neuromorphic optical tactile sensor applied to texture recognition",
        "Robust tactile descriptors for discriminating objects from textural properties via artificial robotic skin",
        "Tactile classification of object materials for virtual reality based robot teleoperation",
        "Robotic tactile perception of object properties: A review",
        "Multimodal proximity and visuotactile sensing with a selectively transmissive soft membrane",
        "Deep active cross-modal visuo-tactile transfer learning for robotic object recognition",
        "Shape-independent hardness estimation using deep learning and a GelSight tactile sensor",
        "Maintaining grasps within slipping bounds by monitoring incipient slip",
        "Tactile Dexterity: Manipulation primitives with tactile feedback",
        "DTact: A vision-based tactile sensor that measures high-resolution 3D geometry directly from darkness",
        "DelTact: A vision-based tactile sensor using a dense color pattern",
        "GelSlim: A high-resolution, compact, robust, and calibrated tactile-sensing finger",
        "Cable manipulation with a tactile-reactive gripper",
        "Tactile tool manipulation",
        "Active extrinsic contact sensing: Application to general peg-in-hole insertion",
        "Visuotactile affordances for cloth manipulation with local control",
        "Goal-driven robotic pushing using tactile and proprioceptive feedback",
        "Autonomous learning of page flipping movements via tactile feedback",
        "Manipulation via Membranes: High-resolution and highly deformable tactile sensing and control",
        "Manipulation by Feel: Touch-based control with deep predictive models",
        "The Feeling of Success: Does touch sensing help predict grasp outcomes?",
        "Grasp stability prediction with sim-to-real transfer from tactile sensing",
        "PoseIt: A visual-tactile dataset of holding poses for grasp stability analysis",
        "A robotic grasping state perception framework with multi-phase tactile information and ensemble learning",
        "More Than a Feeling: Learning to grasp and regrasp using vision and touch",
        "Tactile Regrasp: Grasp adjustments via simulated tactile transformations",
        "Learning generalizable vision-tactile robotic grasping strategy for deformable objects via transformer",
        "Center-of-mass-based robust grasp planning for unknown objects using tactile-visual sensors",
        "Slip detection for grasp stabilization with a multifingered tactile robot hand",
        "Improving grasp stability with rotation measurement from tactile sensing",
        "SwingBot: Learning physical features from in-hand tactile exploration for dynamic swing-up manipulation",
        "TossingBot: Learning to throw arbitrary objects with residual physics",
        "Iterative Residual Policy: for goal-conditioned dynamic manipulation of deformable objects",
        "3D neural scene representations for visuomotor control",
        "Learning multi-object dynamics with compositional neural radiance fields",
        "Global model learning for large deformation control of elastic deformable linear objects: An efficient and adaptive approach",
        "Zero-shot sim-to-real transfer of tactile control policies for aggressive swing-up manipulation",
        "Active clothing material perception using tactile sensing and deep learning",
        "Deep residual learning for image recognition",
        "OptNet: Differentiable optimization as a layer in neural networks",
        "Convex optimization",
        "Dense tactile force estimation using gelslim and inverse FEM",
        "OSQP: an operator splitting solver for quadratic programs",
        "GelSight Wedge: Measuring high-resolution 3D contact geometry with a compact robot finger"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 46 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in LeTac-MPC: Learning Model Predictive Control for Tactile-reactive Grasping, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
